full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 64 of 261 1204 LC6VMAX2 Kate - direct 1 Q. Did that change over time? 2 A. Yes. 3 Q. Through your twenties and early thirties, did you continue to communicate with Epstein? 4 5 A. Yes. 6 Q. Without using any words from the communications, what was the tone of your communications with Epstein generally? 7 8 A. My tone was friendly. 9 MS. STERNHEIM: I'm sorry, I couldn't hear. 10 THE COURT: Friendly. 11 THE WITNESS: Friendly. 12 Q. Why did you keep communicating with Epstein through your twenties and early thirties? 13 14 A. I was -- I did not want to admit what had happened to me. 15 And I felt that by ceasing communication, I would have to acknowledge the events that had taken place and I would have to say something. I was also fearful of disengaging because I had witnessed how connected they both were and I was fearful. 18 19 Q. Did there come a time when you stopped communicating with Epstein? 20 21 A. Yes. 22 Q. Approximately when? 23 A. In my early thirties. 24 Q. And approximately when did you stop spending time with Epstein? 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012815

text_blocks.content:
1 Q. Did that change over time?
2 A. Yes.
3 Q. Through your twenties and early thirties, did you continue to communicate with Epstein?
4
5 A. Yes.
6 Q. Without using any words from the communications, what was the tone of your communications with Epstein generally?
7
8 A. My tone was friendly.
9 MS. STERNHEIM: I'm sorry, I couldn't hear.
10 THE COURT: Friendly.
11 THE WITNESS: Friendly.
12 Q. Why did you keep communicating with Epstein through your twenties and early thirties?
13
14 A. I was -- I did not want to admit what had happened to me.
15 And I felt that by ceasing communication, I would have to acknowledge the events that had taken place and I would have to say something. I was also fearful of disengaging because I had witnessed how connected they both were and I was fearful.
18
19 Q. Did there come a time when you stopped communicating with Epstein?
20
21 A. Yes.
22 Q. Approximately when?
23 A. In my early thirties.
24 Q. And approximately when did you stop spending time with Epstein?

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a witness being questioned about their interactions with Jeffrey Epstein. The tone is formal and the language is professional.
